Key Arguments: The legislation is fundamentally hostile to the principle of free speech.
The ACMA would have excessive powers to control and dictate content on social media.
The bill is part of a broader trend of anti-democratic legislation since the 1970s.
The legislation contradicts the true meaning of democracy, which involves checks and balances on power.
The bill is seen as a step towards global tyranny and a departure from Christian standards that have historically underpinned Western civilization.
Notable Quotes: The proposed Draft Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation is flawed because the whole underpinning ideology is hostile to the principle of free speech.
This draft clearly illustrates an ideological hypocrisy – ‘the intolerance of tolerance’.
Unless Australia goes back to its Christian standards and the processes which guaranteed the success of Western civilisation, this new restrictive tyranny will ensue.
